website_summaries.verdict: If a comfortable grip is important to you, this peeler is definitely worth considering.
pros: Uniquely designed handle won't slip even when wet, and those with arthritis may find it easier to use than other models
Sharp blade peels smoothly without jamming
cons: Not everyone loves the chunky grip

customer_reviews.title: Remove Blade's Protective Strip First!
customer_reviews.text: I initially posted a one-star review labeled "Disappointed" because the peeler scraped the carrots I was preparing rather than peeling them in nice, long strips. Well, count me in as a mental midget -- I did not notice when I cleaned it before use, that there is a thin plastic protective strip on the blade, which obviously made the peeler inoperable. I almost threw the peeler away in disgust, but decided to wash it anyway. It was then that I noticed the protective strip. Once removed, the tool worked beautifully and as expected. So if you do buy this kitchen tool, be sure to remove the protective plastic strip from the blade before employing it!
customer_reviews.author: AntKathy

customer_reviews.title: Pitiful Peeler
customer_reviews.text: In all the years I have been an Amazon customer, I havent left such a bad review of a product as I am leaving for this one. How could this horrible peeler be an "Amazon Choice"? Or for that matter have so many positive reviews? It couldn't peel soft butter! I will go back to the old fashioned simple peelers that I have always used. This one is totally useless.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra

customer_reviews.title: If you paid me $10 to buy this again it'd be $9.99 too much
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to get this peeler cuz I've had a peeler one for many years years that's awful. I read the reviews very good overall . Well I'm right up there now with the bad reviews ! it's not easy to use. Peels come off in tiny pieces they get caught around the blade. I had more of the crap on my shirt then I did on the paper towel on the cutting board as well as on the floor. I used it to peel a sweet potato. I do not recommend this item.. My worst potato peeler is better than this. I am so disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Gumdlops Don't bother to waste your time very unrealistic plot line

customer_reviews.title: Best Vegetable Peeler Ever!
customer_reviews.text: I was perfectly content with my generic vegetable peeler. It did a decent job. Then I tried the Spring Chef Premium Swivel Vegetable Peeler at my daughter's house over Thanksgiving. Where has this little peeler been all my life? It made peeling potatoes effortless! Super comfortable, lightweight, glides over vegetables - plus an unbelievably reasonable price. I'm buying one for my sister, and highly recommend it to anyone. Even if you're happy with your current peeler, just try this one - you won't regret it.
customer_reviews.author: Mary W.

customer_reviews.title: Hands down the best peeler I've ever used
customer_reviews.text: Hands down the best peeler I've ever used! After 15 years in the cooking game, I know my way around a potato. Best part is, I received what I thought was an auto generated email thanking me for my purchase from Founder Brian Davis. I wrote back and said thanks....turns out, it was really him! Good product. Personal touch, which is huge for me in this automated age. Already have other Spring Chef products in mind. Will buy for as long as they make 'em.
customer_reviews.author: Carrie

customer_reviews.title: Kiwi test
customer_reviews.text: Best peeler ever! Nice, big and solid handle to hold. I love that it swivels. I had a very old swivel peeler that I finally needed to replace and got a stationary peeler. They take off big chunks of food with the peel and not easy to use on odd shaped foods. As you can see, this one only takes a thin layer, and when working with very small foods like kiwis, that's a pretty important feature.
customer_reviews.author: T

customer_reviews.title: It was amazing! It just slid through the peels
customer_reviews.text: I used the Spring Chef vegetable peeler for the first time today on potatoes for Thanksgiving tomorrow! OMG! I will NEVER dread peeling potatoes or anything else again for that matter! It was amazing! It just slid through the peels, my hand didn't hurt when I was done, and it did such a clean job of removing the peels! I didn't have to keep going over the same spot. If my old one (10 years +) hadn't fallen apart, I would have never known about this company's products! Yay! If I could give it more stars, I would!
customer_reviews.author: lilhigg

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable, very sharp
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable to hold. So far I've only used it to trim some asparagus but it cut like a dream. The cutting edge is very sharp--it was sitting on my cutting board and I accidentally pushed my knuckle onto it while trying to grab something that was falling and made a nice little slice. When it arrived there was a protective blue film over the cutting edges which was very easy to see but not so easy to remove; I had trouble getting under a corner or edge of the film to pull it clear without giving myself an unwanted manicure.
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: Ideal if you have weak or shaky hands
customer_reviews.text: The only reason I gave this 4 stars is because you can get comparable models from walmart for $3/$4. The only special thing about this peelers is that it is thick and much easier to grasp than most other peelers. If you are have weak hands, shaky hand, or issues gripping thin objects than this is useful for you
customer_reviews.author: Bobert

customer_reviews.title: Works great, use caution
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic peeler for vegetables, best I have ever had. Easy to hold even for a small hand like mine & no problem for a large one. Very sharp blades spaced a little further apart than most peelers to be more efficient. Exercise caution when using as very sharp. Took off 1 star as this one should have a sleeve. Sent a message to the Seller & they are considering the sleeve. Excellent service.
customer_reviews.author: Nobody

customer_reviews.title: Great Peeler!
customer_reviews.text: This peeler is wonderful! I've never been very picky about what peeler I would buy until I realized I was wasting money on low quality peelers! You shouldn't have to replace a peeler very often! Just got the Spring Chef peeler a few days ago and I know I made a great choice! The handle is comfortable in my hand and the blade is very sturdy and thick! That was my biggest complaint about other peelers... flimsy weak blades! I've used it a handful of times already, on carrots, cucumbers, potatoes and it's doing a great job! Very Happy! Even came with an extremely helpful PDF to get the best results with your peeler! Awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Steven Wright

customer_reviews.title: Extremely ineffective
customer_reviews.text: This has to be the worst peeler I've ever owned. Extremely ineffective and very hard to use. Had to return it unfortunately. Very disappointing given the reviews.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No more struggles with Arthritis
customer_reviews.text: It's been years since I've bought a peeler. I was struggling with my old one and my arthritis makes it hard to use. The first thing I tried the Spring Chef on was a butternut squash - always hard to peel. The Spring Chef made this work effortless! Next was a sweet potato, and it was like cutting through butter! The ergonomic handle gives you a firm grip so you're not afraid the peeler is going to fly after giving too much pressure. My only regret is I waited so long to buy one. Excellent product that should be endorsed by the Arthritis Foundation.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worst Peeler Ever Made!!
customer_reviews.text: I don't understand the point of this design. It is senseless and awkward to use. One can peel vegetables in only one direction and you have to readjust the blade every swipe or two. The peeler isn't very sharp, either. It is the most poorly designed and difficult to use peeler I've ever seen! Don't waste your money!
customer_reviews.author: J. Forest

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant Peeler With Good Grips
customer_reviews.text: I do a lot of peeling as a cook, and it's not hard work but it can be tedious. I peel and strip a lot of different fruits and vegetables. When I saw this and read the reviews, thought I'd try changing the old one I have as it wasn't working too well anymore. This is now my favorite peeler! It beats all the peelers I've ever used. Very convenient to use, cuts everything nicely. It's very efficient with an excellent grip, reducing the amount of hard work required.
customer_reviews.author: Trading Robot

customer_reviews.title: Best Vegetable Peeler Ever
customer_reviews.text: I usually wait to review a product until I've used it for at least several weeks if not several months (depending on the product). I'm making an exception. This is the best vegetable peeler I have ever used--at any price. The handle is broad enough and is designed in a way that makes it easy to hold and use safely. The blades are sharp and efficient. If it doesn't hold up over time, I'll edit/amend this review. At this time, I am pleased with this peeler.
customer_reviews.author: Lee Livingood

customer_reviews.title: Good Grip Sized Peeler
customer_reviews.text: Purchased two Spring Chef Premium Swivel Vegetable Peelers. One for my daughter and one for me. The size of the handle is perfect and allows small hands to easily peel veggies. I'm not so sure about the swivel of the peeler. Peels get caught up in the peeler as you work and are less easy to remove. Might go with a stationary peeler if I can find one with similar grip. Daughter feels the same way.
customer_reviews.author: Cali Native

customer_reviews.title: Crap
customer_reviews.text: This broke the very first time I used it. Blade just went flying... But I was making lemon peels. It's probably fine for skins like carrots and potatoes.
customer_reviews.author: Yelnick McGwawa

customer_reviews.title: Best Peeler Ever
customer_reviews.text: I have a couple of other peelers, including a Cutco. But this one surpasses all. Although the Cutco might (and I am not sure) be sharper, the Spring Chef is superior for this reason: peels are a lot less likely to get in the way by sticking to the peeler. Because of how this peeler flexes, it is much less common to discover a peel slice clinging to the peeler, preventing it from doing its job. The peels fall off almost always. Once in a while you have to remove a peel, but less than half as often. Great design, great product.
customer_reviews.author: Edward J. Vasicek

customer_reviews.title: Like butter
customer_reviews.text: This peeler goes through potatoes, carrots, sweet potatoes, and butternut squash like butter. It glides effortlessly through the peel. I am very impressed, and not too many things impress me when it comes to gadgets. HIGHLY recommend. I hope that it last for a long time since I bought it only because my favorite one was accidentally thrown out; and it was a Wusthof that I had for many, many years.
customer_reviews.author: Marlen Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Good peeler! This works much better than the KitchenAid ...
customer_reviews.text: Good peeler! This works much better than the KitchenAid one we had. I had a peeler vs. eggplant battle the other week, and the peeler won hands down! That would have been a different story with the KitchenAid peeler, and even our Pampered Chef peeler struggles with eggplant.
customer_reviews.author: JH

customer_reviews.title: Best Peeler Ever!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is truly the nicest vegetable peeler I have ever owned. My daughter has arthritis in her hands and she can use it easily. You need little to no pressure and it glides easily over the veggies. It makes a very clean peel. My daughter is left handed and I am right handed and it works great for either of us. The handle is well designed and fits the grip of ones hand well. It is a very well crafted item. I could recommend it easily to anyone. It is a great price for what you are getting too.
customer_reviews.author: Lila

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight comfort!
customer_reviews.text: Works great. The pointed triangular part is for hanging the tool on a hook but can so somewhat effectively be used to dig out potato eyes. Can be comfortable used righty or lefty and is nicely light weight reducing hand fatigue and making potato peeling a less intensive experience. This product improves the experience I normally avoid and request my husband to do.
customer_reviews.author: Brighton

customer_reviews.title: Very sharp
customer_reviews.text: I love this new peeler. It peels very quickly and makes thin cuts. It is very sharp and I appreciated the blade cover for storage. I gave easy to use 4 stars because of the exposed sharp edge. It could be dangerous, however, it's not any sharper than my Henkle's knives. The novice chef should be cautious.
customer_reviews.author: bbinmbsc

customer_reviews.title: Broke After Less Than One Year
customer_reviews.text: I didn't like it anyway, but didn't plan to write a review until the blade fell off less than a year later. So, cheaply made. Also, the the blade swiveled so much it was hard to keep it where I wanted on the item being peeled. And peelings kept getting stuck in between the blades. Finally, it was awkward to hold.
customer_reviews.author: Sufi

customer_reviews.title: What a peeler!
customer_reviews.text: What didn’t I love about this peeler, it’s sharp, easy to use and peels exceptionally well. It’s very sturdy, the only thing I can say in the negative is not having a metal eye remover. Remember to remove the protective tape from the blades, but watch your fingers, this puppy is sharp. I have an old peeler I would not give up because all the others I tried couldn’t cut the mustard, it’s at least 30 to 40 years old. After receiving this one I retired my old tired and true peeler.
customer_reviews.author: Janelle Humphreys

customer_reviews.title: Great peeler on a budget
customer_reviews.text: Just used this peeler for the first time after getting rid of my 8+ yr old y-peeler, and it works a treat. Nice and sharp right out the gate, and doesn't take too much of the peel off where I feel like I'm losing half of the veggie that I'm working on. The one thing that would make this 5 stars for me, is if the blades were replaceable. I would pay more for a nice peeler that had replaceable blades, but I can't seem to find one. I guess we live in that kind of world now.
customer_reviews.author: Shean Hoxie

customer_reviews.title: Does not work
customer_reviews.text: This peeler is useless. Difficult to use as you need to press it a hard against potato. Used to work with one the one which has cutter at the top and that was much better and easier. This is super useless.. Avoid it.
customer_reviews.author: Customer12

customer_reviews.title: It is OK for the price
customer_reviews.text: This peeler does the job but it is not great. I tried to peel eggplant and it took me considerably longer than my older peeler. The swivel is stiff and this causes the peeler to miss spots. The price is low but for a little more you could do better.
customer_reviews.author: Snippet

customer_reviews.title: Vegetable peeler for lefties
customer_reviews.text: For years I have suffered with a traditional vegetable peeler and I couldn't identify why, since my husband used it without any trouble. Later I discovered that most of the kitchen appliances are designed to be used with the right hand. This vegetable peeler is designed so it can be used with either hand. Being a leftie, it has made a considerable difference in my meal prep experience. It is comfortable to hold. I can peel the vegetables with ease. I would definitely recommend it for left hand users.
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: using this is a joy and actually inspires me to juice more often
customer_reviews.text: This was one of those 4am purchases that was forgotten and when it arrived, was pleasantly surprised. I really didn't think I would get as much out of it as I have. I have been doing veggie juices regularly and utilizing root veg can be a hassle to take off the skins, using this is a joy and actually inspires me to juice more often. Would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Jellyphish

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic peeler!
customer_reviews.text: Loved this peeler! It is great for veggies that are starchy. I peeled some sweet potatoes, which are normally more challenging to peel with a knife, and it peels like a dream! The skin came off as thin as paper. Absolutely amazing! Harder to use on soft skinned fruits like a kiwi, but it more than makes up for it for harder to peel veggies.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria

customer_reviews.title: WOW!
customer_reviews.text: I'm almost seventy-four years old now and have enjoyed cooking my entire life. All these years I used many vegetable peelers, but never like this one. How I wish that I had known that such a vegetable peeler as this was available for us mere mortals. I'd bet that anyone who ever uses this peeler would never begin to use anything else.
customer_reviews.author: James P McComas

customer_reviews.title: Great for old people
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my dad who was struggling with peeling apples using a knife. After using this peeler, he can easily peel apples without me having to worry about him cutting himself! He is very old and fragile so I'm glad he's able to peel apples with ease now. I no longer have to worry about him peeling apples. I am very satisfied! Note: The peeler has a sticker/plastic on the blades so remember to take it off before using.
customer_reviews.author: Hunter

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: We were in need of new vegetable peelers. I bought two different types. Both were fine, but this one, Spring Chef Premium Swivel Vegetable Peeler, is amazing. It is so easy to use, the blades are very sharp and you can have a potato peeled totally (no need to go back over areas that were missed) the first time you go over an area. Highly recommend! I will be purchasing more of my two daughters-in-law, my third son's girlfriend, and my 18-year-old daughter. Also, the handle on it makes it very comfortable to use.
customer_reviews.author: Donna Smith

customer_reviews.title: Well Made, but,,,,,,,,,
customer_reviews.text: Ergonomically, it is well made. The only issues I had with it was the length and the pointed end. My thought was that the length could 've a little longer providing a better grip for those with large hands. Also, the pointed end was a great idea, but, it could be a little sharper. Instead of picking the eyes out of the potatoes, I was pulling out chunks. In all, I still feel it was a good purchase and nicely made. This is coming from a person who always used the all metal German peeler. This one is now my go to peeler. Scott
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Tool
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift for my son in his first apartment. It was one of his basic kitchen set, but it is one of two items he has raved about. It fits comfortably and stably in his hand, and it's sharp enough to glide through potato, carrot and apple peels quickly and easily. It's left me realizing my own peeler needs replacing. I know exactly which one I'll be buying.
customer_reviews.author: Lin

customer_reviews.title: You know how you didn’t realize how bad your last item you had was until you replace it?
customer_reviews.text: I lost my old peeler and was forced to buy a new one. I was put out, because it was a perfectly good peeler and it didn’t need replacing. However, when I got the new peeler, I realized that I had been fooling myself. This peeler is SO good, highlighting what a knackered piece of crap my old one was. Tip - keep the plastic guard it’s shipped with to put back on the blade after you wash it. It’s sharp.
customer_reviews.author: Daf

customer_reviews.title: Nice if you have big hands
customer_reviews.text: The thing that stood out to me when shopping for a new peeler was the larger handle. I thought that will make it easier to use. However I was wrong. I don't think I really have small hands, but the handle was just too big for me to use comfortable. When you can't hold it properly, you don't get the results you expect. Would not buy it again, but might work very well for others.
customer_reviews.author: WKC

customer_reviews.title: it zipped through sweet potatoes and I was done in no time
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this peeler and it's made peeling a lot quicker then I thought, it zipped through sweet potatoes and I was done in no time, I have been peeling with a knife because I had problems with other peelers, but the Spring Chef peeler removes carrot peelings(and still leaves the carrot) it only removed a thin layer and next I used it for sweet potatoes - again fast and did the job quickly, I highly recommend this company!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Belle

customer_reviews.title: Still using this weekly for 3 years!
customer_reviews.text: Had this for 3 years now. Still going strong. My go-to everyday peeler. Took me a while to get a technique to keep the cucumber skins from flopping back on my hand, but I'm an expert now with peeling those big English cucumbers directly into the trash can each week. Durable. No rust. Comfortable to hold. Thanks for a good product. I hope the quality remains the same. Update!!! I forget to say that I got this because I am left handed. Love this thing.
customer_reviews.author: Genesis6

customer_reviews.title: Simple Tool That Works Well
customer_reviews.text: Hold tight and peel away! I'm not sure why anyone would be having issues with using this peeler. It works great. It's the perfect size for feeling safe in my hands and I've peeled countless fruits and potatoes and carrots in the last two weeks already! I wash and dry all metal tools in the kitchen almost immediately after use, including this one. Take care of your tools and they will take care of you.
customer_reviews.author: Seth K.

customer_reviews.title: This peeler WORKS!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this since my old peeler was beginning to dull. I'm surprised at myself by being excited to write a five star review for a peeler but it was better than any peeler I've ever used. The handle makes it super easy to hold and get a grip on. What blew me away was how thin the peels were. It just takes off the peel while taking the bare minimum off the actual fruit or vegetable which leads to less waste. I recommend this highly and if I ever need another will be getting this one.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Labrada

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: This is a good peeler. Nothing gets stuck in the blades and it does the job well. My only complaint is if you have small hands like I do it is a bit difficult to hold and use, especially with smaller items. I did cut a good cut on the tip of my finger while peeling some small potatoes. Not sure if I would buy it again just because it is bigger than I expected and bulky for my hands. But if you have normal to large size hands, I would buy this peeler.
customer_reviews.author: Meggie

customer_reviews.title: Sharp
customer_reviews.text: This blade is so sharp that it's a breeze to peel a cucumber. You don't have to put any effort into it at all, which also means you don't have to squeeze the cucumber tight to keep it from slipping out of your hand. The blade comes with a plastic cover that is easy to put back on when you're done using it. Nice safety feature that keeps the blade from getting nicked in the drawer, and you from accidentally cutting yourself when grabbing it in the drawer.
customer_reviews.author: Claes A

customer_reviews.title: Peels well, design issues that I don't care for
customer_reviews.text: It peels really well but there are three things that make it just okay. It's made for a larger hand which makes it a little uncomfortable. I have a woman's medium size hand. I didn't realize when I bought it that it doesn't have the tip that you can use to get spots out of potatoes. And third when I take it out of the dishwasher I have to shake it quite a bit to get all the water out.
customer_reviews.author: Denise F.

customer_reviews.title: Glides like butter
customer_reviews.text: Due to certain difficulties I received my peeler last night and it couldn't have come at a better time. Thanks to Brian Davis reaching out to me I was able to put my mind at ease and be able to use my product. I woke up this morning and made a salad for my lunch. I peeled some cucumbers and carrots. The grip was firm and the motion was smooth. Clean up was a breeze.. I haven't scooped anything yet but overall I am happy with my new addition! Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: jay

customer_reviews.title: Very sharp peeler
customer_reviews.text: I really like this peeler and bought three of them in total. It is very harp and easy to peel all the vegetables I typically buy. You have to be very careful when using this peeler. Otherwise it may peel your fingers too as I had done once. Half of my pointer nail was gone as I peeled too fast. Nonetheless, I still like my peeler sharp.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome peeler
customer_reviews.text: I've never had a peeler that works this well. I've had if for about six months now, and I like better than ever. Cucumbers, apples, peaches (messy) you name it. It's so sharp it's almost hard to feel it working. Kind of makes peeling stuff fun. My goal is to get an apple peel off all in one peel. I'm getting there. Recommended highly. If it ever gets dull; I'll buy another.
customer_reviews.author: scsurfer

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME! But be careful not to cut yourself
customer_reviews.text: Wow ... smooth like butter this peels. We kept the protective cover to store for protection but put some blue tape on the cover so we won't lose the cover. The cover is transparent which would make it easy to misplace or throw away by mistake. Otherwise, it feels good in my hand, just he right size and grip. I should've bought this a long time ago.
customer_reviews.author: Rose I. Mogavero

customer_reviews.title: Probably the best peeler I've ever used
customer_reviews.text: I've bought a lot of peelers and it seems that they are never sharp enough and after a few uses just don't peel worth a darn. This peeler has excelled above the rest! I work in a restaurant and this peels extremely well!! Even eggplants that have that slippery skin it has no problem peeling! Would recommend to anyone for sure.
customer_reviews.author: BuRny

customer_reviews.title: peels superbly, both directions!
customer_reviews.text: Great peeler! So many (even expensive ones) just don't peel all that well. I like to peel away from my body, and many other peelers are one-way only (towards yourself). This peeler works really well both directions, with a rapid, smooth peel. It takes off just the right amount of peel. It's easy to hold without being gigantic. Super design at a good price. You'll love this one!
customer_reviews.author: Espressivo

customer_reviews.title: perfect if you are left handed
customer_reviews.text: Heing left handed I struggle finding products that I can use. This worked wonderful for me being left handed. It peeled my potato better then any peeler I have ever used. If I happen to ever need a new one I will rebuy this one.
customer_reviews.author: Mindy Knadler

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value & control
customer_reviews.text: This is based on the feedback of the friend who used the item. It is an excellent peeler for the price. If the grip were better it would be perfect. While a few reviewers do not seem to appreciate the high level control afforded by the blade mounting (e.g. the currently featured negative reviewer states, "the blade moves so the angle into the vegetable changes with each swipe") it makes the tool much more versatile, with a little practice.
customer_reviews.author: ChaseBase

customer_reviews.title: Its pretty good but my old one was better
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace professional peeler I lost. Couldn't remember the brand name, so tried this one. Am liking it more as I continue to use it, was skeptical at first as works differently than one I was used to. Its pretty good but my old one was better. The seller emailed me directly with directions and at first was impressed with the personal touch but didn't feel the directions offered much, mostly just saying how great their product is.
customer_reviews.author: Turquoise

customer_reviews.title: Love This Dual-Action Peeler
customer_reviews.text: My old peeler worked but only in one direction. This one works in both directions regardless of which hand you prefer to use. Perfect. Just what I was looking for. Makes peeling carrots so much easier and faster. If you are a foodie, love to cook, enjoy spending time in the kitchen, you deserve this helpful tool.
customer_reviews.author: Denise A. Barker

customer_reviews.title: Fast, Sharp, and Comfortable Peeler
customer_reviews.text: I very seldom peel potatoes or fruit. I do, however, peel carrots or other very thin skinned vegetables which will be cooked. If carrots are cooked in a liquid (soup) unpeeled, the very thin outer skin loosens and becomes unpleasant. Just this week, I was able to prepare my vegetable soup in much less time because of the speed with which I could peel the the carrots prior to cutting them into "sticks".
customer_reviews.author: Annushka

customer_reviews.title: Peels perfectly!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great peeler. It is comfy to hold and I barely have to put any pressure to get the peel off and it takes just the right amount off. I have no idea how long it will last, but it is going to get a lot of use. I actually really enjoyed peeling a cucumber the other day and was so excited I called my husband over to see how nice it was peeling. Definitely recommend this peeler. Thanks for a great product!
customer_reviews.author: TB

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: This peeler is awesome! It has either been a really long time since we got a new peeler or our last few have not been good quality as this one slides down the veggies like you're shaving butter! I've just recommended it to my mom, who needs a new one as well. I am also excited about the grip as my husband doesn't know his own strength and has crushed a few of our previous peelers just by squeezing too hard while trying to get it to peel carrots or potatoes. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: jessnandy

customer_reviews.title: Workin the potato
customer_reviews.text: It works. It works great for me. Very sharp. Great handle. Best handle I've ever used on a potato peeler. I've peeled like 10 potatoes. Used it twice and seems to be holding up great. No rust. Seems durable enough. I'm using the best potato peeler I've ever used in my life. Pretty cool. Oh, I'm 51. Been cooking since I was about 16. It's the little things in life. Like a good pp.
customer_reviews.author: john mathiesen

customer_reviews.title: The WORST
customer_reviews.text: I wish I still had my old one. This is by far the worst peeler I’ve ever owned. I saw all the reviews and that’s was one of the reasons I purchased it, however, I must have received one that was faulty because it certainly doesn’t work like it should. Maybe the one at the dollar store will work better
customer_reviews.author: a

customer_reviews.title: An excellent vegetable peeler!
customer_reviews.text: This is a simple to use product that does the job very well. My previous vegetable peeler was horrible, and I usually ended up frustrated having to peel the vegetable with a knife. This product was easy to use, and peeled carrots and butternut squash fantastically. I am quite impressed.
customer_reviews.author: John Arena

customer_reviews.title: Seriously...this changed my life
customer_reviews.text: Yeah, it's a peeler. But what a peeler it is! My chitty-chitty-bang-bang old peeler heard many a cuss word the past decade. Finally decided to upgrade and man-oh-man - I went thru those potatoes for homemade fries in about a minute. I love my peeler so much that I've hidden it from my roommate. Let her use the old one.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew J. KeeganTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: The peeler works great, is sharp and has a great grip. My only gripe would be step up the packaging game. A box with a lid, foam insert holding it, etc. Think iPhone. Yes I get it would add to the price, but it would also make you forget the fact it was probably made in China for .50 cents. God Bless America.
customer_reviews.author: WESIII

customer_reviews.title: Great basic peeler, why spend a ton when you could buy this
customer_reviews.text: Great peeler for a fair price. It gets the job done, nothing fancy. I needed a peeler and didn't want to spend a ton on anything extravagant. This was the perfect one for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Stan

customer_reviews.title: Best peeler I ever used
customer_reviews.text: This was so easy to use. Feels comfortable, peels real easy and the eye remover is the easiest ever. You don't have to dig the eye out, you just pop it out because it is shaped the opposite from most peelers. I had the cutco peeler and I thought that was the best but this peeler puts that one to shame and its half the price. If I ever need another one, this is the one I will buy
customer_reviews.author: Linda B

customer_reviews.title: Excellent tool
customer_reviews.text: This peeler is excellent. Super sharp, shaves off the thinnest layer possible. Apply a slight pressure and the layer can be thicker. The shape of the handle is perfectly comfortable, much better than the peelers that claim to be ergonomically designed. I've used this on apples, pears, carrots and cucumber so far. I'm really happy with all aspects of this device and highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Christmas junkie

customer_reviews.title: Effective
customer_reviews.text: Surprise! Who knew a simple peeler could be so much better than any other? I mean, the engineering isn't really complicated. But this peeler is better! It is noticeably easier for me to prepare potatoes, yams and carrots when I use this tool. We're not discussing the relative nutritional merits of peels vs unpeeled here: if you just need the skins off of your spuds today, this is the best tool I have found.
customer_reviews.author: M Smith

customer_reviews.title: Will reorder every time!
customer_reviews.text: You know you’re officially an adult when you have a favorite potato peeler! We have three in the same drawer but this is the only one I’ll use. It fits well in my hand and peels so well and smoothly I don’t ever have to go over a spot more than once. The little sleeve over the blade is handy too because this baby is SHARP!
customer_reviews.author: Johnathon Seely

customer_reviews.title: Versatile and sharp
customer_reviews.text: At first, when my wife used the words, "Versatile and sharp" I thought she was talking about me. it turns out it was about your amazing Swivel Vegetable Peeler! She went on, saying it zests with ease (another thing she could have said about me, really) but again it was about your amazing peeler. Well done! I am in competition with your wonderful product and will try to do better!
customer_reviews.author: hd

customer_reviews.title: I used my Spring Chef peeler for the first time today and it was awesome! It was super sturdy and made quick work ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Spring Chef Premium Swivel Vegetable Peeler because the peelers that I had were flimsy and, in general, did a cruddy job. I used my Spring Chef peeler for the first time today and it was awesome! It was super sturdy and made quick work of the pile of potatoes that needed to be peeled. We are hosting Thanksgiving again this year and I will be using my Spring Chef peeler to tackle the 15 pounds of potatoes I will be cooking. In fact, I liked this peeler so much I ordered a second one in hopes that someone will help me with all those many pounds of potatoes that will need to be peeled for T-Day.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great peeler.
customer_reviews.text: Works like a charm. I’ve always been a parting knife kinda girl and this helps with time and I don’t lose as much of my veggies with this.
customer_reviews.author: Lizzie O'Brien

customer_reviews.title: Best peeler I have found
customer_reviews.text: This peeler is the best I have found so far. The handle is a little big, which makes holding it while peeling towards you a little challenging. But, with a little hand position adjustment, it's fine. That being said, it is really sharp and works so well, I have bought an additional one so I always have a clean one around. I would recommend this peeler for sure
customer_reviews.author: Mary R

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable handle and razor sharp
customer_reviews.text: I didn't know what I was missing when I was using our decades-old vegetable peeler! It was one of those spindly metal ones that would make my hand cramp. And, the old one would skim over vegetable skins like cucumbers before digging in with more force. So, imagine how happy I am to have a peeler that has a comfortable handle and cuts like a razor! It makes me able to follow Jacque Pepin's method of doing one long continuous stroke.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Beauregard

customer_reviews.title: I am disappointed in this product
customer_reviews.text: I needed a sharp peeler with a handle much easier than these in the market place. This one looked like the answer to my dilemma. The handle is good - not great- but it is very awkward to navigate in order to use. Even when it is positioned is doesn't peel the vegetable easily. It is too much hassle to use.
customer_reviews.author: LAWonder10

customer_reviews.title: Peeler keeps a picky "chef" happy.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my husband who hates my old fashioned peeler and somehow lost the one he had been using. He really likes this one. I heard him bragging on the phone the other day to someone about how great this peeler was. (Yes, he's recently retired and commandeered the kitchen). So, I'm assuming if it makes I'm that happy, it will make others happy as well, as he's pretty particular.
customer_reviews.author: Edith Kimberley Baker

customer_reviews.title: Love , love this product !
customer_reviews.text: I love this product . I am the cheif food preparer for my family and I suffer from , nerve damage , and carpal tunnel syndrome in my hand and wrist . The kitchen aide I had bought some where else , wasn't even a good vegetable peeler . I had never heard of this company before , but I did look at the reviews . I was still somewhat skeptical . But it is perfect and lightweight amd peels carrots ect like nothing .
customer_reviews.author: Angels

customer_reviews.title: " A peeler  is a kitchen tool consisting of a slotted metal blade attached to a handle..."
customer_reviews.text: My last vegetable peeler was almost 30 years old... so this new one is a treat! I used it for the first time to peel ginger which is difficult at best. Since it does swivel, I was able to peel the ginger without using a paring knife. I would caution those who have the old peelers... this one is sharp!
customer_reviews.author: klibrarian

customer_reviews.title: Best peeler ever! So easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: This is THE BEST veggie peeler I’ve ever had! I used it to peel carrots and barely had to press, the thinnest layers of skin came off, resulting in the least waste possible. It was legit like I was petting a stick of butter. So smooth and sharp. I definitely recommend this to older people or people with grip issues or arthritis as it was so easy/seamless to use.
customer_reviews.author: Stacey Page

customer_reviews.title: outstanding
customer_reviews.text: This was a surprisingly great purchase! It peels really thinly and efficiently, and the blade is nice and sharp. I came from a home with a lot of excellent kitchen tools, so when I had to buy my own for my own kitchen, I was a little intimidated, especially since I'm filling my kitchen on a very tight budget. I bought this peeler because it was cheap and had decent reviews, but I wasn't expected the great quality. Overall, I really love this peeler and would definitely recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Alexis

customer_reviews.title: The Best Peeler in my Drawer!
customer_reviews.text: I am really enjoying this new vegetable peeler. From the minute I took it out of the package, I knew it wasn't like the ones I'd had before. There is a weight in your hand and a sharp efficient blade and the entire product is VERY well made. I've used it several times already on potatoes, lemons, oranges, apples and even celery to remove the tough ribs. It has worked amazingly! The price was a little higher than most vegetable peelers you can find at box stores but you immediately can tell you got what you paid for. The order came quickly and the item was well packaged. I'm actually thinking I might just buy a 2nd one!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Triple the price it should be
customer_reviews.text: Uncomfortable to use. This product is triple the price. I saw the same product today at TJ Maxx and Target. I thought it was a new and improved peeler but it's not.
customer_reviews.author: Myra

customer_reviews.title: Razor sharp, effortless usage.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this because it looked well-made and it turned out to be pretty awesome. Last night I made Butternut bisque soup and one of the ingredients was carrot. I can tell you if you do nothing more than rest the peeler on the carrot and start peeling it will peel. Maybe there was a little downward force but I assure you not much. Incredibly sharp and the swivel feature for the blade is an excellent design feature. I was thinking this as a gift actually for some foodies I know but then I was thinking why insult their current peeler - not worth it. But truly a great product and razor sharp.
customer_reviews.author: Jim deChef

customer_reviews.title: Cuts Fingers as Well as Veggies
customer_reviews.text: While that may be operator error, I've had several different kinds of peelers over the years, and this is the first one that scares me. That said, I confess it does a great job peeling carrots and potatoes. I'll just need to keep my fingers out of the way.
customer_reviews.author: Lucy's Mom

customer_reviews.title: ‘Peeling’ pretty good about this decision!
customer_reviews.text: Why on earth did I wait so long to buy a new peeler? Game changer, makes peeling potatoes, zucchini’s and cucumbers so much easier and faster. Great quality product, easy to clean, Sharp blades, feels nice and sturdy. Treat yourself - just add it to your cart, you deserve it!
customer_reviews.author: Bee

customer_reviews.title: Replace Your Peeler Periodically
customer_reviews.text: You know, you don't think that your old peeler can get dull but it does. After 30-something years I decided to dump my old one and buy a new one. Boy does it make a difference!!! A fresh blade cuts the peeling time in half and each slice is as clean as could be. I highly recommend this small investment for those of you who spend time in the kitchen or for that spur-of-the-moment bris.
customer_reviews.author: Sarcastic Marc

customer_reviews.title: Sharp, easy, actually works!
customer_reviews.text: My sons (my potato peelers) were happy to have a very quality peeler that worked with minimal effort! Usually they complain about how hard potatoes and veggies are to peel, this time they fought over who got to be the “peeler” because it was so easy! Fast too!
customer_reviews.author: TJCarr

customer_reviews.title: Cuts like butter!
customer_reviews.text: This product is super great for peeling vegetables - I used it on a cucumber and it cut with ease. Super easy to use. I wish it had a better case, though, because the blade is super sharp. It came with a small plastic blade cover, but it doesn’t stay on well unfortunately. Falls right off.
customer_reviews.author: Brianna

customer_reviews.title: Great price for the item very much worth well
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item to place a similar potato peeler that we have had for a long time. I am glad to say that I’m very satisfied with the purchase, the price, the quality and the service, that’s why I give it five stars. I would definitely recommend it
customer_reviews.author: Orlando

customer_reviews.title: Best darn potato peeler I've ever used!
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately I lost my favorite potato peeler made in Switzerland that I had for years and loved it and thought there was nothing else that would replace it. But man I was wrong! This is now my new favorite! It feels very comfortable in your hand feels solid! The blade in particular looks particularly larger than average and appears to be made out of some quality stainless! I knew as soon as I filled the first potato I was in love!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great potato peeler.
customer_reviews.text: I have had the same vegetable peeler for 20+ years. I have bought others that didn't work as well, so I always went back to my old peeler. Recently, my good old reliable peeler went missing. So, I got this one. First time I used it, it was amazing. Sharp and easy to hold. Made peeling 10 pounds of potatoes not as much of a chore.
customer_reviews.author: Kelley Werner

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t Swivel
customer_reviews.text: The blade of the one I received doesn’t swivel smoothly. It will turn if you position it manually, but then you have to keep holding it at that angle. I think it might be that the plastic was not molded properly, or not trimmed. I should have bought a cheap metal one. I could have bought 4 for the same money. At least one of those four would work properly.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy

customer_reviews.title: Wow, paying a few buck more for a good peeler is worth it!
customer_reviews.text: I had no idea how much difference a well designed peeler makes. I've always used cheap ones and this one makes a huge difference. Worth the extra few dollars! Very sharp, easy to hold.
customer_reviews.author: Megarian

customer_reviews.title: Spectacular!
customer_reviews.text: As odd at it seems, this is my new favorite kitchen tool. It peels veggies with ridiculous ease. Maybe because for so long I had slicers that were trash, I didn't ever expect to get something that I actually found pleasurable to use, but this far exceeded my expectations. Awesome little veggie slicer.
customer_reviews.author: REGINA

customer_reviews.title: Best Peeler I've Ever Had!
customer_reviews.text: I use this to peel vegetables. I have small hands but this one fits very well for both me and my son. What is even more important is that is easy to get the eyes out of potatoes with this peeler. Others I've had often required multiple attacks per eye .
customer_reviews.author: Norma Horne

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: This is the nicest peeler I've ever had. Sturdy, easy to grip with the finger grooves and the bonus doohickey on the end for liking out the bad spots on taters so I don't have to use both a peeler and a knife. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: DANA A

customer_reviews.title: Best peeler ever
customer_reviews.text: It glides over all sorts of vegetables like nobody’s business. I actually enjoy peeling things with this tool... like I think it’s fun and I know how lame that sounds, but trust me it’s fun. This thing makes zoodles and carrot ribbons like BAM! One of my favorite kitchen tools!
customer_reviews.author: Malefko

customer_reviews.title: This is great!
customer_reviews.text: I knew the minute I started to use this peeler that it was a great purchase. It works beautifully and is much faster than my previous peeler. I thought that one was good until I used this one. I love it! I have large hands and it fits perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: L. L. W.

customer_reviews.title: Sharp blade, easily pealing
customer_reviews.text: I could not be happier with my purchase, just used it today and wow! It just slides, easily pealed off the eggplant. It was really comfortable and I did not feel the slightest pressure on my wrist (I have gangelion cyst on my wrist and is painful). I am just planning to order more.
customer_reviews.author: Roxana

customer_reviews.title: Really like this peeler. Very sharp!
customer_reviews.text: Use it for peeling vegetables. The only thing I hate is when a potato or carrot peel gets stuck in the blades. I have to stop peeling & remove it to begin peeling again. Doesn't happen often. Thats my only pet peeve.
customer_reviews.author: DN

product_meta.title: Spring Chef Premium Swivel Vegetable Peeler
feature_bullets: Dual Stainless Steel blades stay ultra sharp and swivel for smooth, effortless peeling. Includes a built-in blemish remover.
Customers adore it: "I cannot put into words how amazing this peeler is! ... Skins peel off like they are melted butter without gouging your fruits or veggies" - Stephanie
Smooth Glide Technology: Won't clog with peels. Dishwasher Safe.
Comfortable, non-slip handle for both right and left-handed use with hook for easy storage.
Ergonomic design is lightweight and efficient even for those with arthritis. LIFETIME Warranty.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.8 out of 5 stars7,958 ratings4.8 out of 5 stars
